sub_title: Risk Consultancy | Quants | Business Analysis | Digital Transformation | Data Analytics | Digital Products
summary:
Founder of Romhle Enterprise and an Expert in Business Analysis across various domains, Banking, Risk Management (Basel, IFRS9, ALM, Credit Risk, Market Risk and OP Risk), Information Technology, Insurance, Fintech and Digital Transformation, Brian is a result driven gentleman  with an innovative mind. He has a great passion for  Innovation, Problem Solving, Human Centered and a strong believer of hard work and creativity.  He is multi-talented, with great skill in understanding business and market dynamics, developing solutions for under-serviced  markets, digital transformation, programming and gifted with immaculate complex problem solving skills and analytical thinking power.
My Business Analysis expertise and business management acumen has made a significant impact helping organisations implement solutions quicker, efficiently and in a well documented manner. 
Socially Brian enjoys a good round of golf and is a great chess player.

documents

contributors.headline: Risk Consultancy | Quants | Business Analysis | Digital Transformation | Data Analytics | Digital Products

projects.title: A foreign currency options pricing model and a trading application for the Zimbabwean Market
projects.description:
This study seeks to develop a foreign currency options pricing and trading model for the Zimbabwean market. There is a need for a foreign exchange options market where Zimbabwean companies and traders can hedge themselves against foreign currency risks. These instruments have not been traded in Zimbabwe, hence the researcher seeks to outline the fundamentals of foreign currency options, and how foreign currency options have been traded in other advanced markets like the Johannesburg Stock Exchange (JSE). Seeing that most options are priced using the Black Scholes Model the researcher will seek to highlight the limitations of the Black Scholes model. The researcher will seek to outline the different types of models that are used to price foreign currency options, most of which will be derived from Stochastic Differential Equations (SDEs). 
Further the researcher will develop an appropriate foreign currency options pricing model. However to ensure that this is not just an advancement in mathematical modelling, the researcher will henceforth develop a derivatives market trading simulator. This trading simulator (coded in Visual Basic and C++) will allow traders to trade foreign currency options.

projects.title: Digital Assistant and Chatbot

Social media platforms have a very huge subscription base. Most people spend 60-80% of their time on social media Given this background, Old Mutual needed a solution to help service its customers within the social media space through offering realtime advise, quotations and giving them the option to buy insurance services on social media platforms with little to no human intervention

Role in the Project

This resulted in me choosing an Agile methodology in implementing the Chatbot and my core activities included:

projects.title: Credit Card Fraud Detection System
projects.description:
Credit Card Fraud has been on the rise globally. Within the Old Mutual Context, CABS would suffer huge losses in the event that a customer lost money due to a card cloning, bogus online transaction  or any other event outside the customer's control. The main reason for this project was to help the organisation identify, monitor and reduce Credit Card Fraud Risk.

Not only was this a regulatory requirement, it was also helping the business save a lot of money.

Role in the project

Project documentation ( Concept Note, Business Case, Business Requirements Document, Test Strategy, End User Training Module)
Conducting Workshops and Stakeholder Engagements ( Business Requirement Gathering Workshops)
Process Mapping (AS and to be Processes)
Data modelling

projects.title: Weather Index Insurance
projects.description:
Weather index Insurance is an Micronsurance Product  where claims are triggered by a weather measure( in our case rainfall data) and paid without the policy holder having to submit a claim. 

We implemented the Weather Index Insurance Product under the Bluemarble Microinsurance Consortium to service the needs of smallscale farmers in Africa.

In the event of inadequate or excessive rainfall, crop yields are affected and farmers find themselves incapable of getting the anticipated harvest. Weather index insurance seeks to compensate farmers when this happens.

Role in the Product

Develop a tool for pulling weather data from GIS server using R
Uploading and maintaining the weather index tracking tool to determine if triggers have been met
Documenting requirements and ensuring that the Index tracking stream reported on all the progress made
Conducting surveys to verify if the data received from the satellite was consistent with the ground readings
Tools Used
R
Python
Microsoft Excel
Microsoft Visio

projects.title: Gadget Insurance Product
projects.description:
Traditional insurance products ( Personal All Risk, Homeowners, House Contents) tend to be very expensive and require one's assets to be of a certain value in order to be insured. Offering Gadget insurance cover as a standalone product was one of the ways of tapping into the under-insured markets by reducing the barriers of entry into the insurance sector while servicing a need.

Most young people are constantly glued to their gadgets, if anything happens to that gadget, they tend to be so devastated and the gadget insurance cover sought to assist this in the event of an unintended loss.

My Role

Market Research
Product Design and Development
Investigation into Product Distribution Channels
Product Pricing and Profitability Analysis
Meeting Potential Partners
Product Terms and Policy Design
Artefacts Produced

Gadget insurance Policy Wording
Pricing Engine
Profitability analysis Models
Tools Used

Actuarial Modelling tools
Human Centred Design Models
Social Media Platforms

contributors.headline: Risk Consultancy | Quants | Business Analysis | Digital Transformation | Data Analytics | Digital Products

projects.title: Management of Investment portfolios using optimisation models
projects.description: When investors go into investment deals their main aim is to achieve a great return and while exposing themselves to ideal risk conditions. Various optimization models have been used in determining a favorable investment portfolio. The mean variance theory by Harry Markowizt laid a very strong foundation to optimization of investment portfolios. His method was built mainly on quadratic programming which is an optimization model. The researcher sought to quantify quadratic programming as well as advocate for the use of other improvisation models such as goal programming in solving investment portfolio problems

contributors.headline: Risk Consultancy | Quants | Business Analysis | Digital Transformation | Data Analytics | Digital Products

projects.title: Effectiveness of Circumcision in the prevention of HIV and AIDS
projects.description:
This is a statistical project, whose main aim was to test the effectiveness of circumcision in reducing HIV. A survey was done across the National University of Science and Technology nust, where the researcher distributed questionnaires amongst student to hear what they thought of circumcision, if they had been circumcised and all.
Further to the survey the student then used statistical inferences, hypothesis testing and statistical packages to determine whether circumcision is effective in reducing HIV from the public's view

profile_positions.description:
I currently consult for Rabobank through Varryln as a Senior Business Analyst within the ALM tribe.
My main focus is to help the bank close all ILAAP gaps and findings.
This is through :
1. The development of Liquidity Gap Profiles for both T0 and Future
2. Development of an application that takes into account various scenarios  and assumptions to calculate Future Cash Flows ( Behavioural and Contractual)
3. development of an application that calculates both T0 and Future Liquidity Indicators 
a. LCR  and Stressed LCR( Liquid Coverage Ratio)
b. NSFR+( Net Stable Funding Ratio)
c. LtSF (Loan to Stable Funding Ratio)
d. LtD ( Loan to Deposit Ratio)
e. WDC (wholesale deposit concentration)
f. Asset Encumbrance
g. Comb Stress (CS)
 
Furthermore I meet with various stakeholders from the Balance sheet management team and Finance to get clear requirements and business rules that should be incorporated into our application .
I also take time to manage stakeholder expectations by giving periodic updates on how we are progressing in our tasks.
Technically I use a lot of SQL scripts to pull data from various sources and heavily rely on excel for my analysis. 
Other technologies we use as a team include Power BI, Azure clouds services and C#.
profile_positions.title: Senior Business Analyst (ALM)

profile_positions.description: I currently consult for Standard Bank Corporate and Investment Banking as a Senior Business and Data Analyst. Standard bank is working on a solution to standardise data across core banking systems through the use of the FpML (Financial products Markup Language) Standard. This project was first initiated in 2013, however over the years FpML has upgraded and a lot of standard bank messages are still using the older FpML version, also not all banking systems are generating FpML messages. My main role in this project is to conduct an analysis of Current Standard Bank Schemas and compare them with the latest FPML Schemas. Furthermore I then come up with Functional requirements specifications to enable alignment with the current FpML standard.

profile_positions.description:
As a senior consultant I worked with banks in various regions African, Middle east and Europe where we implemented Risk management solutions for banks around IFRS9 Basel (1,2 and 3) ALM and IRRBB. 
My role within the team was Business Analysis and providing Expert Solutions to clients around IFRS 9, Basel (1,2 and 3), Regulatory analysis and reporting and ensuring that our solutions captured both the client’s and regulatory requirements.
My daily duties included the following activities:
• Participation in presales meetings and presentations, preparation of presales slide decks;
• Providing Expert advice on sound implementation of IFRS 9 and Basel, ALM and IRRBB Requirements
• Participation in Client workshops, requirement analysis, definition and GAP analysis according to Employer’s standards;
• Creation of project documentation – Business Solution Design Documents, Business Requirement Documents,
Technical Specification Documents, UAT, and scope documents, User Manuals and Configuration
Documentation.
• Functional Design of the Enterprise Risk Management and Capital Markets solutions.
• Configuration of Solutions subject to implementation.
• Unit testing of configured Solutions, preparation of Unit test reports.
• Support of the User Acceptance Testing conducted by the Client – issue resolution and consultations of Client’s
personnel.
• Conducting trainings of internal team members and Client’s personnel.
• Work with task tracking and bug tracking systems according to the Employer’s standards.
• Implementing Finastra Fusion Risk
• Writing SQL scripts when necessary

profile_positions.title: Innovation Manager

profile_positions.description:
In March 2018, Brian Joined CABS a subsidiary of Old Mutual Limited as a Market and Quant Risk Specialist. in this role Brian provides second line of defense for capital and earnings against market risk, supplements efforts by treasury. This involves independent measurement, monitoring and reporting of market and quantitative risks through validating effectiveness and adherence to risk policies, processes, limits and other internal controls by line management. 
My role involves the following:



a)	Monitoring the asset and liability position (structural position) of the Institution and providing advisory role to the Institution’s Treasurer on the best possible strategies to consider given market trends.

b)	Analysing market and liquidity risks inherent in the society’s portfolio and tracking actual risk indicators against the Institution’s benchmarks. 

c)	Monitoring adherence to policies and procedures by both treasury front and back offices and reporting on incidents of deviation there from.

d)	Performing stress tests on the institution’s capital (Economic Capital and Capital Adequacy Ratio), interest rate, foreign exchange and liquidity risks. 

e)	Formulating and recommending policies and procedures for identification, measurement and management of market and liquidity risks within Central Africa Building Society [‘Society’ or ‘Institution’] in conjunction with the Head of Risk.

f)	Review, monitor, and prepare independent market risk monitoring reports to the Asset / Liability Management Committee, Board Risk and Compliance Committee and various other committees across the Old Mutual Group.
profile_positions.title: Market and Quant Risk Specialist

profile_positions.description: As the Senior MIS Specialist my role evolved around 4 key result areas, Data Science and Analysis, Product Pricing and Development,  Digital and Innovation and finally Business Analysis and Process engineering.

profile_positions.description:
As the Business Analyst I reported to the Head of Project Office, the General Manager and Managing Director with full accountabilities for the following areas:
BUSINESS ANALYSIS “BA”
• Identifying, investigating, and analysing business processes, procedures and work practices
• Identifying and evaluating inefficiencies and recommending optimal business practices, and system functionality and behaviour

DATA ANALYTICS AND PREDICTIVE MODELLING
• As the data analyst, I analysed claims and underwriting performance.
• I employed data modelling, statistical analysis and predictive analytics techniques to predict future business growths and future loss ratios to help the business in reserving.

Key Successes Include:
• Developing the Old Mutual Insurance Data Analytics and Reporting tool using SQL, Python and Microsoft Power BI 
• Developing the gadget insurance, courtesy car, No claims discount Roadside assistance product and weather index insurance.
• Winning the Old Mutual Group Creative Solutions Award
profile_positions.title: Business Analyst

profile_positions.description:
In 2014 Brian was appointed MIS Specialist for Old Mutual Zimbabwe where he reported to the General Manager and the Managing Director of the Short term Insurance division. Considering that this was a fairly new role in the organisation, this role involved wearing many hats. It combined aspects from various fields, Business Analysis, Actuarial modelling, Market research and Product development and Pricing. Brian was tasked to:
 
1. Develop and redesign products in line with customer's needs and specifications
2. Identify problem areas in business, by collecting data, processing and analysing data, validating and evaluating the data so as to come up with alternative solutions
3. Analyse trends  in work allocated to suppliers
4. Price products and define terms 
5. Analyse performance and uptake of products
6. Extract and provide data to the claims investigation bureau

Most of the analysis involved the use of R, Microsoft Power BI tools, SQL and SAS.
profile_positions.title: MIS Specialist

profile_positions.title: Actuarial Analyst

volunteer_experiences.description:
I would describe my experiences at the Bulawayo Junior City Council as the best experiences of my life. During that period as a student in A'level we would initiate social activities, visit children's homes, and also child prisons, to advocate for youth empowerment as well as alleviate the plight of the less privileged in the society. 
I also participated in the National Budget Formulation Conference that was facilitated by NANGO where we sought to deliberate on the 2009 national budget to assert if it was child friendly or not. Using our findings we lobbied with child parliament in Zimbabwe to ensure that the needs of the less privileged children in our society were addressed.
